question: ‘Portraits of Power’ is the autobiography of which famous Indian personality?
explanation:
Veteran economist and bureaucrat N K Singh has recently released autobiography titled ‘Portraits of Power’.
The book highlights the various stints of N K Singh during his career starting from 1964 when he joined the Indian Administrative Service (IAS). N K Singh, who served in the Prime Minister’s Office as Secretary from 1998-2001, is the Chairman of the 15th Finance Commission.
